snippet: A new study says a genetic defect may play a role in causing hyperactive behavior, suggesting that at least in some cases, hyperactivity can have a neurobiological root.
abstract: Jean M Hebert study in journal Science finds that genetic defect in inner ear may play role in causing hyperactive behavior in children who have severe hearing loss; finding suggests that at least in some cases, hyperactivity can have a neurobiological root.
lead_paragraph: A new study says a genetic defect may play a role in causing hyperactive behavior, suggesting that at least in some cases, hyperactivity can have a neurobiological root.

headline.print_headline: Behavior: Hyperactivity Linked to Inner Ear Defect
headline.main: Hyperactivity Linked to Inner Ear Defect
